# HELP app_info information about qdrant server

app_info{name="qdrant",version="0.11.1"} 1

cluster_enabled 0
# HELP collections_total number of collections
# TYPE collections_total gauge
collections_total 1

time.description: Time spent to process this request

post.description:
Use context and a target to find the most similar points to the target, constrained by the context.
When using only the context (without a target), a special search - called context search - is performed where pairs of points are used to generate a loss that guides the search towards the zone where most positive examples overlap. This means that the score minimizes the scenario of finding a point closer to a negative than to a positive part of a pair.
Since the score of a context relates to loss, the maximum score a point can get is 0.0, and it becomes normal that many points can have a score of 0.0.
When using target (with or without context), the score behaves a little different: The integer part of the score represents the rank with respect to the context, while the decimal part of the score relates to the distance to the target. The context part of the score for each pair is calculated +1 if the point is closer to a positive than to a negative part of a pair, and -1 otherwise.

requestBody.description: Request points based on {positive, negative} pairs of examples, and/or a target

parameters.description: Name of the collection to search in

info.title: Qdrant API

externalDocs.description: Find out more about Qdrant applications and demo

tags.name: Indexes
tags.description: Indexes for payloads associated with points.

tags.name: Beta
tags.description: Beta features, do not depend on these yet.

api-key.name: api-key
api-key.description: Authorization key, either read-write or read-only

time.description: Time spent to process this request

CollectionInfo.description: Current statistics and configuration of the collection

indexed_vectors_count.description: Approximate number of indexed vectors in the collection. Indexed vectors in large segments are faster to query, as it is stored in a specialized vector index.

points_count.description: Approximate number of points (vectors + payloads) in collection. Each point could be accessed by unique id.

segments_count.description: Number of segments in collection. Each segment has independent vector as payload indexes

CollectionStatus.description: Current state of the collection. `Green` - all good. `Yellow` - optimization is running, 'Grey' - optimizations are possible but not triggered, `Red` - some operations failed and was not recovered

oneOf.description: Optimizers are reporting as expected
Something wrong happened with optimizers

metadata.description: Arbitrary JSON metadata for the collection This can be used to store application-specific information such as creation time, migration data, inference model info, etc.

shard_number.description: Number of shards the collection has

sharding_method.description: Sharding method Default is Auto - points are distributed across all available shards Custom - points are distributed across shards according to shard key

replication_factor.description: Number of replicas for each shard

write_consistency_factor.description: Defines how many replicas should apply the operation for us to consider it successful. Increasing this number will make the collection more resilient to inconsistencies, but will also make it fail if not enough replicas are available. Does not have any performance impact.

read_fan_out_factor.description: Defines how many additional replicas should be processing read request at the same time. Default value is Auto, which means that fan-out will be determined automatically based on the busyness of the local replica. Having more than 0 might be useful to smooth latency spikes of individual nodes.

on_disk_payload.description:
If true - point's payload will not be stored in memory. It will be read from the disk every time it is requested. This setting saves RAM by (slightly) increasing the response time. Note: those payload values that are involved in filtering and are indexed - remain in RAM.

Default: true

sparse_vectors.description: Configuration of the sparse vector storage

VectorParams.description: Params of single vector data storage

hnsw_config.description: Custom params for HNSW index. If none - values from collection configuration are used.

quantization_config.description: Custom params for quantization. If none - values from collection configuration are used.

on_disk.description: If true, vectors are served from disk, improving RAM usage at the cost of latency Default: false

datatype.description:
Defines which datatype should be used to represent vectors in the storage. Choosing different datatypes allows to optimize memory usage and performance vs accuracy.

- For `float32` datatype - vectors are stored as single-precision floating point numbers, 4 bytes. - For `float16` datatype - vectors are stored as half-precision floating point numbers, 2 bytes. - For `uint8` datatype - vectors are stored as unsigned 8-bit integers, 1 byte. It expects vector elements to be in range `[0, 255]`.

Distance.description: Type of internal tags, build from payload Distance function types used to compare vectors

m.description: Number of edges per node in the index graph. Larger the value - more accurate the search, more space required.

ef_construct.description: Number of neighbours to consider during the index building. Larger the value - more accurate the search, more time required to build the index.

full_scan_threshold.description: Minimal size threshold (in KiloBytes) below which full-scan is preferred over HNSW search. This measures the total size of vectors being queried against. When the maximum estimated amount of points that a condition satisfies is smaller than `full_scan_threshold_kb`, the query planner will use full-scan search instead of HNSW index traversal for better performance. Note: 1Kb = 1 vector of size 256

max_indexing_threads.description: Number of parallel threads used for background index building. If 0 - automatically select from 8 to 16. Best to keep between 8 and 16 to prevent likelihood of building broken/inefficient HNSW graphs. On small CPUs, less threads are used.

on_disk.description: Store HNSW index on disk. If set to false, the index will be stored in RAM. Default: false

payload_m.description: Custom M param for additional payload-aware HNSW links. If not set, default M will be used.

inline_storage.description: Store copies of original and quantized vectors within the HNSW index file. Default: false. Enabling this option will trade the search speed for disk usage by reducing amount of random seeks during the search. Requires quantized vectors to be enabled. Multi-vectors are not supported.

quantile.description: Quantile for quantization. Expected value range in [0.5, 1.0]. If not set - use the whole range of values

always_ram.description: If true - quantized vectors always will be stored in RAM, ignoring the config of main storage

query_encoding.description: Asymmetric quantization configuration allows a query to have different quantization than stored vectors. It can increase the accuracy of search at the cost of performance.

SparseVectorParams.description: Params of single sparse vector data storage

index.description: Custom params for index. If none - values from collection configuration are used.

modifier.description: Configures addition value modifications for sparse vectors. Default: none

full_scan_threshold.description:
We prefer a full scan search upto (excluding) this number of vectors.

Note: this is number of vectors, not KiloBytes.

on_disk.description: Store index on disk. If set to false, the index will be stored in RAM. Default: false

datatype.description:
Defines which datatype should be used for the index. Choosing different datatypes allows to optimize memory usage and performance vs accuracy.

- For `float32` datatype - vectors are stored as single-precision floating point numbers, 4 bytes. - For `float16` datatype - vectors are stored as half-precision floating point numbers, 2 bytes. - For `uint8` datatype - vectors are quantized to unsigned 8-bit integers, 1 byte. Quantization to fit byte range `[0, 255]` happens during indexing automatically, so the actual vector data does not need to conform to this range.

Modifier.description: If used, include weight modification, which will be applied to sparse vectors at query time: None - no modification (default) Idf - inverse document frequency, based on statistics of the collection

m.description: Number of edges per node in the index graph. Larger the value - more accurate the search, more space required.

ef_construct.description: Number of neighbours to consider during the index building. Larger the value - more accurate the search, more time required to build index.

full_scan_threshold.description: Minimal size threshold (in KiloBytes) below which full-scan is preferred over HNSW search. This measures the total size of vectors being queried against. When the maximum estimated amount of points that a condition satisfies is smaller than `full_scan_threshold_kb`, the query planner will use full-scan search instead of HNSW index traversal for better performance. Note: 1Kb = 1 vector of size 256

max_indexing_threads.description: Number of parallel threads used for background index building. If 0 - automatically select from 8 to 16. Best to keep between 8 and 16 to prevent likelihood of slow building or broken/inefficient HNSW graphs. On small CPUs, less threads are used.

on_disk.description: Store HNSW index on disk. If set to false, index will be stored in RAM. Default: false

payload_m.description: Custom M param for hnsw graph built for payload index. If not set, default M will be used.

inline_storage.description: Store copies of original and quantized vectors within the HNSW index file. Default: false. Enabling this option will trade the search speed for disk usage by reducing amount of random seeks during the search. Requires quantized vectors to be enabled. Multi-vectors are not supported.

deleted_threshold.description: The minimal fraction of deleted vectors in a segment, required to perform segment optimization

vacuum_min_vector_number.description: The minimal number of vectors in a segment, required to perform segment optimization

default_segment_number.description:
Target amount of segments optimizer will try to keep. Real amount of segments may vary depending on multiple parameters: - Amount of stored points - Current write RPS

It is recommended to select default number of segments as a factor of the number of search threads, so that each segment would be handled evenly by one of the threads. If `default_segment_number = 0`, will be automatically selected by the number of available CPUs.

max_segment_size.description:
Do not create segments larger this size (in kilobytes). Large segments might require disproportionately long indexation times, therefore it makes sense to limit the size of segments.

If indexing speed is more important - make this parameter lower. If search speed is more important - make this parameter higher. Note: 1Kb = 1 vector of size 256 If not set, will be automatically selected considering the number of available CPUs.

memmap_threshold.description:
Maximum size (in kilobytes) of vectors to store in-memory per segment. Segments larger than this threshold will be stored as read-only memmapped file.

Memmap storage is disabled by default, to enable it, set this threshold to a reasonable value.

To disable memmap storage, set this to `0`. Internally it will use the largest threshold possible.

Note: 1Kb = 1 vector of size 256

indexing_threshold.description:
Maximum size (in kilobytes) of vectors allowed for plain index, exceeding this threshold will enable vector indexing

Default value is 10,000, based on experiments and observations.

To disable vector indexing, set to `0`.

Note: 1kB = 1 vector of size 256.

max_optimization_threads.description: Max number of threads (jobs) for running optimizations per shard. Note: each optimization job will also use `max_indexing_threads` threads by itself for index building. If null - have no limit and choose dynamically to saturate CPU. If 0 - no optimization threads, optimizations will be disabled.

wal_capacity_mb.description: Size of a single WAL segment in MB

wal_segments_ahead.description: Number of WAL segments to create ahead of actually used ones

wal_retain_closed.description: Number of closed WAL segments to keep

enabled.description: Whether strict mode is enabled for a collection or not.

max_query_limit.description: Max allowed `limit` parameter for all APIs that don't have their own max limit.

unindexed_filtering_retrieve.description: Allow usage of unindexed fields in retrieval based (e.g. search) filters.

unindexed_filtering_update.description: Allow usage of unindexed fields in filtered updates (e.g. delete by payload).

search_max_hnsw_ef.description: Max HNSW value allowed in search parameters.

search_allow_exact.description: Whether exact search is allowed or not.

search_max_oversampling.description: Max oversampling value allowed in search.

max_collection_vector_size_bytes.description: Max size of a collections vector storage in bytes, ignoring replicas.

read_rate_limit.description: Max number of read operations per minute per replica

write_rate_limit.description: Max number of write operations per minute per replica

max_collection_payload_size_bytes.description: Max size of a collections payload storage in bytes

max_points_count.description: Max number of points estimated in a collection

filter_max_conditions.description: Max conditions a filter can have.

condition_max_size.description: Max size of a condition, eg. items in `MatchAny`.

max_payload_index_count.description: Max number of payload indexes in a collection

max_vectors.description: Max number of vectors in a multivector

PayloadIndexInfo.description: Display payload field type & index information

points.description: Number of points indexed with this index

PayloadSchemaType.description: All possible names of payload types

is_tenant.description: If true - used for tenant optimization. Default: false.

on_disk.description: If true, store the index on disk. Default: false.

lookup.description: If true - support direct lookups. Default is true.

range.description: If true - support ranges filters. Default is true.

is_principal.description: If true - use this key to organize storage of the collection data. This option assumes that this key will be used in majority of filtered requests. Default is false.

on_disk.description: If true, store the index on disk. Default: false. Default is false.

is_principal.description: If true - use this key to organize storage of the collection data. This option assumes that this key will be used in majority of filtered requests.

on_disk.description: If true, store the index on disk. Default: false.
If true, store the index on disk. Default: false.

lowercase.description: If true, lowercase all tokens. Default: true.

phrase_matching.description: If true, support phrase matching. Default: false.

stopwords.description: Ignore this set of tokens. Can select from predefined languages and/or provide a custom set.

on_disk.description: If true, store the index on disk. Default: false.

languages.description: Set of languages to use for stopwords. Multiple pre-defined lists of stopwords can be combined.

custom.description: Custom stopwords set. Will be merged with the languages set.

StemmingAlgorithm.description: Different stemming algorithms with their configs.

on_disk.description: If true, store the index on disk. Default: false.

is_principal.description: If true - use this key to organize storage of the collection data. This option assumes that this key will be used in majority of filtered requests.

on_disk.description: If true, store the index on disk. Default: false.

is_tenant.description: If true - used for tenant optimization.

on_disk.description: If true, store the index on disk. Default: false.

shard_key.description: Specify in which shards to look for the points, if not specified - look in all shards

with_payload.description: Select which payload to return with the response. Default is true.

ExtendedPointId.description: Type, used for specifying point ID in user interface

WithPayloadInterface.description: Options for specifying which payload to include or not

anyOf.description: If `true` - return all payload, If `false` - do not return payload

PayloadSelector.description: Specifies how to treat payload selector

exclude.description: Exclude this fields from returning payload

WithVector.description: Options for specifying which vector to include

anyOf.description: If `true` - return all vector, If `false` - do not return vector

payload.description: Payload - values assigned to the point

values.description: Values and indices must be the same length

SearchRequest.description: Search request. Holds all conditions and parameters for the search of most similar points by vector similarity given the filtering restrictions.

shard_key.description: Specify in which shards to look for the points, if not specified - look in all shards

filter.description: Look only for points which satisfies this conditions

limit.description: Max number of result to return

offset.description: Offset of the first result to return. May be used to paginate results. Note: large offset values may cause performance issues.

with_payload.description: Select which payload to return with the response. Default is false.

with_vector.description: Options for specifying which vectors to include into response. Default is false.

score_threshold.description: Define a minimal score threshold for the result. If defined, less similar results will not be returned. Score of the returned result might be higher or smaller than the threshold depending on the Distance function used. E.g. for cosine similarity only higher scores will be returned.

should.description: At least one of those conditions should match

min_should.description: At least minimum amount of given conditions should match

match.description: Check if point has field with a given value

range.description: Check if points value lies in a given range

geo_bounding_box.description: Check if points geolocation lies in a given area

geo_radius.description: Check if geo point is within a given radius

geo_polygon.description: Check if geo point is within a given polygon

values_count.description: Check number of values of the field

is_empty.description: Check that the field is empty, alternative syntax for `is_empty: "field_name"`

is_null.description: Check that the field is null, alternative syntax for `is_null: "field_name"`

MatchValue.description: Exact match of the given value

MatchTextAny.description: Full-text match of at least one token of the string.

MatchPhrase.description: Full-text phrase match of the string.

MatchAny.description: Exact match on any of the given values

MatchExcept.description: Should have at least one value not matching the any given values

GeoBoundingBox.description:
Geo filter request

Matches coordinates inside the rectangle, described by coordinates of lop-left and bottom-right edges

GeoRadius.description:
Geo filter request

Matches coordinates inside the circle of `radius` and center with coordinates `center`

radius.description: Radius of the area in meters

GeoPolygon.description:
Geo filter request

Matches coordinates inside the polygon, defined by `exterior` and `interiors`

interiors.description: Interior lines (if present) bound holes within the surface each GeoLineString must consist of a minimum of 4 points, and the first and last points must be the same.

GeoLineString.description: Ordered sequence of GeoPoints representing the line

IsEmptyCondition.description: Select points with empty payload for a specified field

IsNullCondition.description: Select points with null payload for a specified field

HasVectorCondition.description: Filter points which have specific vector assigned

Nested.description: Select points with payload for a specified nested field

hnsw_ef.description: Params relevant to HNSW index Size of the beam in a beam-search. Larger the value - more accurate the result, more time required for search.

exact.description: Search without approximation. If set to true, search may run long but with exact results.

indexed_only.description: If enabled, the engine will only perform search among indexed or small segments. Using this option prevents slow searches in case of delayed index, but does not guarantee that all uploaded vectors will be included in search results

ignore.description: If true, quantized vectors are ignored. Default is false.

rescore.description: If true, use original vectors to re-score top-k results. Might require more time in case if original vectors are stored on disk. If not set, qdrant decides automatically apply rescoring or not.

oversampling.description:
Oversampling factor for quantization. Default is 1.0.

Defines how many extra vectors should be pre-selected using quantized index, and then re-scored using original vectors.

For example, if `oversampling` is 2.4 and `limit` is 100, then 240 vectors will be pre-selected using quantized index, and then top-100 will be returned after re-scoring.

score.description: Points vector distance to the query vector

payload.description: Payload - values assigned to the point

UpdateStatus.description: `Acknowledged` - Request is saved to WAL and will be process in a queue. `Completed` - Request is completed, changes are actual.

RecommendRequest.description:
Recommendation request. Provides positive and negative examples of the vectors, which can be ids of points that are already stored in the collection, raw vectors, or even ids and vectors combined.

Service should look for the points which are closer to positive examples and at the same time further to negative examples. The concrete way of how to compare negative and positive distances is up to the `strategy` chosen.

shard_key.description: Specify in which shards to look for the points, if not specified - look in all shards

positive.description: Look for vectors closest to those

negative.description: Try to avoid vectors like this

strategy.description: How to use positive and negative examples to find the results

filter.description: Look only for points which satisfies this conditions

limit.description: Max number of result to return

offset.description: Offset of the first result to return. May be used to paginate results. Note: large offset values may cause performance issues.

with_payload.description: Select which payload to return with the response. Default is false.

with_vector.description: Options for specifying which vectors to include into response. Default is false.

score_threshold.description: Define a minimal score threshold for the result. If defined, less similar results will not be returned. Score of the returned result might be higher or smaller than the threshold depending on the Distance function used. E.g. for cosine similarity only higher scores will be returned.

using.description: Define which vector to use for recommendation, if not specified - try to use default vector

lookup_from.description: The location used to lookup vectors. If not specified - use current collection. Note: the other collection should have the same vector size as the current collection

RecommendStrategy.description:
How to use positive and negative examples to find the results, default is `average_vector`:

* `average_vector` - Average positive and negative vectors and create a single query with the formula `query = avg_pos + avg_pos - avg_neg`. Then performs normal search.

* `best_score` - Uses custom search objective. Each candidate is compared against all examples, its score is then chosen from the `max(max_pos_score, max_neg_score)`. If the `max_neg_score` is chosen then it is squared and negated, otherwise it is just the `max_pos_score`.

* `sum_scores` - Uses custom search objective. Compares against all inputs, sums all the scores. Scores against positive vectors are added, against negatives are subtracted.

LookupLocation.description: Defines a location to use for looking up the vector. Specifies collection and vector field name.

collection.description: Name of the collection used for lookup

vector.description: Optional name of the vector field within the collection. If not provided, the default vector field will be used.

shard_key.description: Specify in which shards to look for the points, if not specified - look in all shards

ScrollRequest.description: Scroll request - paginate over all points which matches given condition

shard_key.description: Specify in which shards to look for the points, if not specified - look in all shards

offset.description: Start ID to read points from.

filter.description: Look only for points which satisfies this conditions. If not provided - all points.

with_payload.description: Select which payload to return with the response. Default is true.

order_by.description: Order the records by a payload field.

direction.description: Direction of ordering: `asc` or `desc`. Default is ascending.

start_from.description: Which payload value to start scrolling from. Default is the lowest value for `asc` and the highest for `desc`

ScrollResult.description: Result of the points read request

next_page_offset.description: Offset which should be used to retrieve a next page result

CreateCollection.description: Operation for creating new collection and (optionally) specify index params

shard_number.description:
For auto sharding: Number of shards in collection. - Default is 1 for standalone, otherwise equal to the number of nodes - Minimum is 1

For custom sharding: Number of shards in collection per shard group. - Default is 1, meaning that each shard key will be mapped to a single shard - Minimum is 1

sharding_method.description: Sharding method Default is Auto - points are distributed across all available shards Custom - points are distributed across shards according to shard key

replication_factor.description: Number of shards replicas. Default is 1 Minimum is 1

write_consistency_factor.description: Defines how many replicas should apply the operation for us to consider it successful. Increasing this number will make the collection more resilient to inconsistencies, but will also make it fail if not enough replicas are available. Does not have any performance impact.

on_disk_payload.description:
If true - point's payload will not be stored in memory. It will be read from the disk every time it is requested. This setting saves RAM by (slightly) increasing the response time. Note: those payload values that are involved in filtering and are indexed - remain in RAM.

Default: true

hnsw_config.description: Custom params for HNSW index. If none - values from service configuration file are used.

wal_config.description: Custom params for WAL. If none - values from service configuration file are used.

optimizers_config.description: Custom params for Optimizers.  If none - values from service configuration file are used.

init_from.description:
Specify other collection to copy data from.

Deprecated since Qdrant 1.15.0.

quantization_config.description: Quantization parameters. If none - quantization is disabled.

metadata.description: Arbitrary JSON metadata for the collection This can be used to store application-specific information such as creation time, migration data, inference model info, etc.

wal_capacity_mb.description: Size of a single WAL segment in MB

wal_segments_ahead.description: Number of WAL segments to create ahead of actually used ones

wal_retain_closed.description: Number of closed WAL segments to retain

deleted_threshold.description: The minimal fraction of deleted vectors in a segment, required to perform segment optimization

vacuum_min_vector_number.description: The minimal number of vectors in a segment, required to perform segment optimization

default_segment_number.description:
Target amount of segments optimizer will try to keep. Real amount of segments may vary depending on multiple parameters: - Amount of stored points - Current write RPS

It is recommended to select default number of segments as a factor of the number of search threads, so that each segment would be handled evenly by one of the threads If `default_segment_number = 0`, will be automatically selected by the number of available CPUs

max_segment_size.description:
Do not create segments larger this size (in kilobytes). Large segments might require disproportionately long indexation times, therefore it makes sense to limit the size of segments.

If indexation speed have more priority for your - make this parameter lower. If search speed is more important - make this parameter higher. Note: 1Kb = 1 vector of size 256

memmap_threshold.description:
Maximum size (in kilobytes) of vectors to store in-memory per segment. Segments larger than this threshold will be stored as read-only memmapped file.

Memmap storage is disabled by default, to enable it, set this threshold to a reasonable value.

To disable memmap storage, set this to `0`.

Note: 1Kb = 1 vector of size 256

Deprecated since Qdrant 1.15.0

indexing_threshold.description:
Maximum size (in kilobytes) of vectors allowed for plain index, exceeding this threshold will enable vector indexing

Default value is 20,000, based on <https://github.com/google-research/google-research/blob/master/scann/docs/algorithms.md>.

To disable vector indexing, set to `0`.

Note: 1kB = 1 vector of size 256.

max_optimization_threads.description: Max number of threads (jobs) for running optimizations per shard. Note: each optimization job will also use `max_indexing_threads` threads by itself for index building. If "auto" - have no limit and choose dynamically to saturate CPU. If 0 - no optimization threads, optimizations will be disabled.

InitFrom.description: Operation for creating new collection and (optionally) specify index params

enabled.description: Whether strict mode is enabled for a collection or not.

max_query_limit.description: Max allowed `limit` parameter for all APIs that don't have their own max limit.

unindexed_filtering_retrieve.description: Allow usage of unindexed fields in retrieval based (e.g. search) filters.

unindexed_filtering_update.description: Allow usage of unindexed fields in filtered updates (e.g. delete by payload).

search_max_oversampling.description: Max oversampling value allowed in search.

condition_max_size.description: Max size of a condition, eg. items in `MatchAny`.

max_payload_index_count.description: Max number of payload indexes in a collection

UpdateCollection.description: Operation for updating parameters of the existing collection

vectors.description: Map of vector data parameters to update for each named vector. To update parameters in a collection having a single unnamed vector, use an empty string as name.

optimizers_config.description: Custom params for Optimizers.  If none - it is left unchanged. This operation is blocking, it will only proceed once all current optimizations are complete

params.description: Collection base params. If none - it is left unchanged.

hnsw_config.description: HNSW parameters to update for the collection index. If none - it is left unchanged.

quantization_config.description: Quantization parameters to update. If none - it is left unchanged.

sparse_vectors.description: Map of sparse vector data parameters to update for each sparse vector.

metadata.description: Metadata to update for the collection. If provided, this will merge with existing metadata. To remove metadata, set it to an empty object.

VectorsConfigDiff.description:
Vector update params for multiple vectors

{ "vector_name": { "hnsw_config": { "m": 8 } } }

hnsw_config.description: Update params for HNSW index. If empty object - it will be unset.

quantization_config.description: Update params for quantization. If none - it is left unchanged.

on_disk.description: If true, vectors are served from disk, improving RAM usage at the cost of latency

replication_factor.description: Number of replicas for each shard

write_consistency_factor.description: Minimal number successful responses from replicas to consider operation successful

read_fan_out_factor.description: Fan-out every read request to these many additional remote nodes (and return first available response)

on_disk_payload.description: If true - point's payload will not be stored in memory. It will be read from the disk every time it is requested. This setting saves RAM by (slightly) increasing the response time. Note: those payload values that are involved in filtering and are indexed - remain in RAM.

ChangeAliasesOperation.description: Operation for performing changes of collection aliases. Alias changes are atomic, meaning that no collection modifications can happen between alias operations.

AliasOperations.description: Group of all the possible operations related to collection aliases

CreateAlias.description: Create alternative name for a collection. Collection will be available under both names for search, retrieve,

RenameAliasOperation.description: Change alias to a new one

RenameAlias.description: Change alias to a new one

update_filter.description: If specified, only points that match this filter will be updated, others will be inserted

Vector.description: Vector Data Vectors can be described directly with values Or specified with source "objects" for inference

Document.description:
WARN: Work-in-progress, unimplemented

Text document for embedding. Requires inference infrastructure, unimplemented.

text.description: Text of the document. This field will be used as input for the embedding model.

model.description: Name of the model used to generate the vector. List of available models depends on a provider.

options.description: Additional options for the model, will be passed to the inference service as-is. See model cards for available options.

DocumentOptions.description: Option variants for text documents. Ether general-purpose options or BM25-specific options. BM25-specific will only take effect if the `qdrant/bm25` is specified as a model.

Bm25Config.description: Configuration of the local bm25 models.

k.description: Controls term frequency saturation. Higher values mean term frequency has more impact. Default is 1.2

b.description: Controls document length normalization. Ranges from 0 (no normalization) to 1 (full normalization). Higher values mean longer documents have less impact. Default is 0.75.

avg_len.description: Expected average document length in the collection. Default is 256.

language.description: Defines which language to use for text preprocessing. This parameter is used to construct default stopwords filter and stemmer. To disable language-specific processing, set this to `"language": "none"`. If not specified, English is assumed.

lowercase.description: Lowercase the text before tokenization. Default is `true`.

stopwords.description: Configuration of the stopwords filter. Supports list of pre-defined languages and custom stopwords. Default: initialized for specified `language` or English if not specified.

stemmer.description: Configuration of the stemmer. Processes tokens to their root form. Default: initialized Snowball stemmer for specified `language` or English if not specified.

min_token_len.description: Minimum token length to keep. If token is shorter than this, it will be discarded. Default is `None`, which means no minimum length.

max_token_len.description: Maximum token length to keep. If token is longer than this, it will be discarded. Default is `None`, which means no maximum length.

Image.description:
WARN: Work-in-progress, unimplemented

Image object for embedding. Requires inference infrastructure, unimplemented.

image.description: Image data: base64 encoded image or an URL

model.description: Name of the model used to generate the vector. List of available models depends on a provider.

options.description: Parameters for the model Values of the parameters are model-specific

InferenceObject.description:
WARN: Work-in-progress, unimplemented

Custom object for embedding. Requires inference infrastructure, unimplemented.

object.description: Arbitrary data, used as input for the embedding model. Used if the model requires more than one input or a custom input.

model.description: Name of the model used to generate the vector. List of available models depends on a provider.

options.description: Parameters for the model Values of the parameters are model-specific

update_filter.description: If specified, only points that match this filter will be updated, others will be inserted

VectorStruct.description: Full vector data per point separator with single and multiple vector modes

SetPayload.description: This data structure is used in API interface and applied across multiple shards

points.description: Assigns payload to each point in this list

filter.description: Assigns payload to each point that satisfy this filter condition

key.description: Assigns payload to each point that satisfy this path of property

DeletePayload.description: This data structure is used in API interface and applied across multiple shards

keys.description: List of payload keys to remove from payload

points.description: Deletes values from each point in this list

filter.description: Deletes values from points that satisfy this filter condition

ClusterStatus.description: Information about current cluster status and structure

oneOf.description: Description of enabled cluster

peers.description: Peers composition of the cluster with main information

message_send_failures.description: Consequent failures of message send operations in consensus by peer address. On the first success to send to that peer - entry is removed from this hashmap.

PeerInfo.description: Information of a peer in the cluster

RaftInfo.description: Summary information about the current raft state

term.description: Raft divides time into terms of arbitrary length, each beginning with an election. If a candidate wins the election, it remains the leader for the rest of the term. The term number increases monotonically. Each server stores the current term number which is also exchanged in every communication.

commit.description: The index of the latest committed (finalized) operation that this peer is aware of.

pending_operations.description: Number of consensus operations pending to be applied on this peer

role.description: Role of this peer in the current term

is_voter.description: Is this peer a voter or a learner

StateRole.description: Role of the peer in the consensus

ConsensusThreadStatus.description: Information about current consensus thread status

MessageSendErrors.description: Message send failures for a particular peer

CountRequest.description: Count Request Counts the number of points which satisfy the given filter. If filter is not provided, the count of all points in the collection will be returned.

shard_key.description: Specify in which shards to look for the points, if not specified - look in all shards

filter.description: Look only for points which satisfies this conditions

exact.description: If true, count exact number of points. If false, count approximate number of points faster. Approximate count might be unreliable during the indexing process. Default: true

count.description: Number of points which satisfy the conditions

CollectionClusterInfo.description: Current clustering distribution for the collection

points_count.description: Number of points in the shard

ReplicaState.description: State of the single shard within a replica set.

to_shard_id.description:
Target shard ID if different than source shard ID

Used exclusively with `ReshardStreamRecords` transfer method.

sync.description: If `true` transfer is a synchronization of a replicas If `false` transfer is a moving of a shard from one peer to another

comment.description: A human-readable report of the transfer progress. Available only on the source peer.

ShardTransferMethod.description: Methods for transferring a shard from one node to another.

oneOf.description: Stream all shard records in batches until the whole shard is transferred.
Snapshot the shard, transfer and restore it on the receiver.
Attempt to transfer shard difference by WAL delta.
Shard transfer for resharding: stream all records in batches until all points are transferred.

ReshardingDirection.description: Resharding direction, scale up or down in number of shards

oneOf.description: Scale up, add a new shard
Scale down, remove a shard

all.description:
Magic feature flag that enables all features.

Note that this will only be applied to all flags when passed into [`init_feature_flags`].

payload_index_skip_rocksdb.description:
Skip usage of RocksDB in new immutable payload indices.

First implemented in Qdrant 1.13.5. Enabled by default in Qdrant 1.14.1

payload_index_skip_mutable_rocksdb.description: Skip usage of RocksDB in new mutable payload indices.

payload_storage_skip_rocksdb.description:
Skip usage of RocksDB in new payload storages.

On-disk payload storages never use Gridstore.

First implemented in Qdrant 1.15.0.

incremental_hnsw_building.description:
Use incremental HNSW building.

Enabled by default in Qdrant 1.14.1.

migrate_rocksdb_id_tracker.description:
Migrate RocksDB based ID trackers into file based ID tracker on start.

Enabled by default in Qdrant 1.15.0.

migrate_rocksdb_vector_storage.description: Migrate RocksDB based vector storages into new format on start.

migrate_rocksdb_payload_storage.description: Migrate RocksDB based payload storages into new format on start.

migrate_rocksdb_payload_indices.description:
Migrate RocksDB based payload indices into new format on start.

Rebuilds a new payload index from scratch.

appendable_quantization.description: Use appendable quantization in appendable plain segments.

healing_threshold.description: Enable HNSW healing if the ratio of missing points is no more than this value. To disable healing completely, set this value to `0.0`.

metadata.description: Arbitrary JSON metadata for the collection

total_optimized_points.description: Total number of optimized points since the last start.

vectors_size_bytes.description: An ESTIMATION of effective amount of bytes used for vectors Do NOT rely on this number unless you know what you are doing

payloads_size_bytes.description: An estimation of the effective amount of bytes used for payloads Do NOT rely on this number unless you know what you are doing

num_points.description: Sum of segment points This is an approximate number Do NOT rely on this number unless you know what you are doing

num_vectors.description: Sum of number of vectors in all segments This is an approximate number Do NOT rely on this number unless you know what you are doing

ShardStatus.description:
Current state of the shard (supports same states as the collection)

`Green` - all good. `Yellow` - optimization is running, 'Grey' - optimizations are possible but not triggered, `Red` - some operations failed and was not recovered

vectors_size_bytes.description: An ESTIMATION of effective amount of bytes used for vectors Do NOT rely on this number unless you know what you are doing

payloads_size_bytes.description: An estimation of the effective amount of bytes used for payloads

VectorDataConfig.description: Config of single vector data storage

quantization_config.description: Vector specific quantization config that overrides collection config

multivector_config.description: Vector specific configuration to enable multiple vectors per point

datatype.description: Vector specific configuration to set specific storage element type

oneOf.description:
Storage in memory (RAM)

Will be very fast at the cost of consuming a lot of memory.

Storage in mmap file, not appendable

Search performance is defined by disk speed and the fraction of vectors that fit in memory.

Storage in chunked mmap files, appendable

Search performance is defined by disk speed and the fraction of vectors that fit in memory.

Same as `ChunkedMmap`, but vectors are forced to be locked in RAM In this way we avoid cold requests to disk, but risk to run out of memory

Designed as a replacement for `Memory`, which doesn't depend on RocksDB
Do not use any index, scan whole vector collection during search. Guarantee 100% precision, but may be time consuming on large collections.
Use filterable HNSW index for approximate search. Is very fast even on a very huge collections, but require additional space to store index and additional time to build it.

SparseVectorDataConfig.description: Config of single sparse vector data storage

full_scan_threshold.description:
We prefer a full scan search upto (excluding) this number of vectors.

Note: this is number of vectors, not KiloBytes.

datatype.description: Datatype used to store weights in the index.

oneOf.description: Mutable RAM sparse index
Immutable RAM sparse index
Mmap sparse index
Storage on disk (rocksdb storage)
Storage in memory maps (gridstore storage)

avg_duration_micros.description: The average time taken by 128 latest operations, calculated as a weighted mean.

min_duration_micros.description: The minimum duration of the operations across all the measurements.

max_duration_micros.description: The maximum duration of the operations across all the measurements.

total_duration_micros.description: The total duration of all operations in microseconds.

points_values_count.description: The amount of values indexed for all points.

points_count.description: The amount of points that have at least one value indexed.

TrackerStatus.description: Represents the current state of the optimizer being tracked

PeerMetadata.description: Metadata describing extra properties for each peer

active_bytes.description: Total number of bytes in active pages allocated by the application

allocated_bytes.description: Total number of bytes allocated by the application

metadata_bytes.description: Total number of bytes dedicated to metadata

resident_bytes.description: Maximum number of bytes in physically resident data pages mapped

retained_bytes.description: Total number of bytes in virtual memory mappings

HardwareUsage.description: Usage of the hardware resources, spent to process the request

method.description: Method for transferring the shard from one node to another
Method for transferring the shard from one node to another

shards_number.description: How many shards to create for this key If not specified, will use the default value from config

replication_factor.description: How many replicas to create for each shard If not specified, will use the default value from config

placement.description: Placement of shards for this key List of peer ids, that can be used to place shards for this key If not specified, will be randomly placed among all peers

priority.description: Defines which data should be used as a source of truth if there are other replicas in the cluster. If set to `Snapshot`, the snapshot will be used as a source of truth, and the current state will be overwritten. If set to `Replica`, the current state will be used as a source of truth, and after recovery if will be synchronized with the snapshot.

checksum.description: Optional SHA256 checksum to verify snapshot integrity before recovery.

api_key.description: Optional API key used when fetching the snapshot from a remote URL.

SnapshotPriority.description:
Defines source of truth for snapshot recovery:

`NoSync` means - restore snapshot without *any* additional synchronization. `Snapshot` means - prefer snapshot data over the current state. `Replica` means - prefer existing data over the snapshot.

WriteOrdering.description:
Defines write ordering guarantees for collection operations

* `weak` - write operations may be reordered, works faster, default

* `medium` - write operations go through dynamically selected leader, may be inconsistent for a short period of time in case of leader change

* `strong` - Write operations go through the permanent leader, consistent, but may be unavailable if leader is down

ReadConsistency.description:
Read consistency parameter

Defines how many replicas should be queried to get the result

* `N` - send N random request and return points, which present on all of them

* `majority` - send N/2+1 random request and return points, which present on all of them

* `quorum` - send requests to all nodes and return points which present on majority of them

* `all` - send requests to all nodes and return points which present on all of them

Default value is `Factor(1)`

ReadConsistencyType.description:
* `majority` - send N/2+1 random request and return points, which present on all of them

* `quorum` - send requests to all nodes and return points which present on majority of nodes

* `all` - send requests to all nodes and return points which present on all nodes

points.description: Deletes values from each point in this list

filter.description: Deletes values from points that satisfy this filter condition

hits.description: Scored points that have the same value of the group_by key

lookup.description: Record that has been looked up using the group id

GroupId.description: Value of the group_by key, shared across all the hits in the group

shard_key.description: Specify in which shards to look for the points, if not specified - look in all shards

filter.description: Look only for points which satisfies this conditions

with_payload.description: Select which payload to return with the response. Default is false.

with_vector.description: Options for specifying which vectors to include into response. Default is false.

score_threshold.description: Define a minimal score threshold for the result. If defined, less similar results will not be returned. Score of the returned result might be higher or smaller than the threshold depending on the Distance function used. E.g. for cosine similarity only higher scores will be returned.

group_by.description: Payload field to group by, must be a string or number field. If the field contains more than 1 value, all values will be used for grouping. One point can be in multiple groups.

group_size.description: Maximum amount of points to return per group

limit.description: Maximum amount of groups to return

with_lookup.description: Look for points in another collection using the group ids

collection.description: Name of the collection to use for points lookup

with_payload.description: Options for specifying which payload to include (or not)

with_vectors.description: Options for specifying which vectors to include (or not)

shard_key.description: Specify in which shards to look for the points, if not specified - look in all shards

positive.description: Look for vectors closest to those

negative.description: Try to avoid vectors like this

strategy.description: How to use positive and negative examples to find the results

filter.description: Look only for points which satisfies this conditions

with_payload.description: Select which payload to return with the response. Default is false.

with_vector.description: Options for specifying which vectors to include into response. Default is false.

score_threshold.description: Define a minimal score threshold for the result. If defined, less similar results will not be returned. Score of the returned result might be higher or smaller than the threshold depending on the Distance function used. E.g. for cosine similarity only higher scores will be returned.

using.description: Define which vector to use for recommendation, if not specified - try to use default vector

lookup_from.description: The location used to lookup vectors. If not specified - use current collection. Note: the other collection should have the same vector size as the current collection

group_by.description: Payload field to group by, must be a string or number field. If the field contains more than 1 value, all values will be used for grouping. One point can be in multiple groups.

group_size.description: Maximum amount of points to return per group

limit.description: Maximum amount of groups to return

with_lookup.description: Look for points in another collection using the group ids

checksum.description: Optional SHA256 checksum to verify snapshot integrity before recovery.

api_key.description: Optional API key used when fetching the snapshot from a remote URL.

DiscoverRequest.description: Use context and a target to find the most similar points, constrained by the context.

shard_key.description: Specify in which shards to look for the points, if not specified - look in all shards

target.description:
Look for vectors closest to this.

When using the target (with or without context), the integer part of the score represents the rank with respect to the context, while the decimal part of the score relates to the distance to the target.

context.description:
Pairs of { positive, negative } examples to constrain the search.

When using only the context (without a target), a special search - called context search - is performed where pairs of points are used to generate a loss that guides the search towards the zone where most positive examples overlap. This means that the score minimizes the scenario of finding a point closer to a negative than to a positive part of a pair.

Since the score of a context relates to loss, the maximum score a point can get is 0.0, and it becomes normal that many points can have a score of 0.0.

For discovery search (when including a target), the context part of the score for each pair is calculated +1 if the point is closer to a positive than to a negative part of a pair, and -1 otherwise.

filter.description: Look only for points which satisfies this conditions

limit.description: Max number of result to return

offset.description: Offset of the first result to return. May be used to paginate results. Note: large offset values may cause performance issues.

with_payload.description: Select which payload to return with the response. Default is false.

with_vector.description: Options for specifying which vectors to include into response. Default is false.

using.description: Define which vector to use for recommendation, if not specified - try to use default vector

lookup_from.description: The location used to lookup vectors. If not specified - use current collection. Note: the other collection should have the same vector size as the current collection

CollectionExistence.description: State of existence of a collection, true = exists, false = does not exist

prefetch.description: Sub-requests to perform first. If present, the query will be performed on the results of the prefetch(es).

query.description: Query to perform. If missing without prefetches, returns points ordered by their IDs.

using.description: Define which vector name to use for querying. If missing, the default vector is used.

filter.description: Filter conditions - return only those points that satisfy the specified conditions.

params.description: Search params for when there is no prefetch

score_threshold.description: Return points with scores better than this threshold.

limit.description: Max number of points to return. Default is 10.

offset.description: Offset of the result. Skip this many points. Default is 0

with_vector.description: Options for specifying which vectors to include into the response. Default is false.

with_payload.description: Options for specifying which payload to include or not. Default is false.

lookup_from.description: The location to use for IDs lookup, if not specified - use the current collection and the 'using' vector Note: the other collection vectors should have the same vector size as the 'using' vector in the current collection

prefetch.description: Sub-requests to perform first. If present, the query will be performed on the results of the prefetches.

query.description: Query to perform. If missing without prefetches, returns points ordered by their IDs.

using.description: Define which vector name to use for querying. If missing, the default vector is used.

filter.description: Filter conditions - return only those points that satisfy the specified conditions.

params.description: Search params for when there is no prefetch

score_threshold.description: Return points with scores better than this threshold.

limit.description: Max number of points to return. Default is 10.

lookup_from.description: The location to use for IDs lookup, if not specified - use the current collection and the 'using' vector Note: the other collection vectors should have the same vector size as the 'using' vector in the current collection

mmr.description: Perform MMR (Maximal Marginal Relevance) reranking after search, using the same vector in this query to calculate relevance.

Mmr.description: Maximal Marginal Relevance (MMR) algorithm for re-ranking the points.

diversity.description:
Tunable parameter for the MMR algorithm. Determines the balance between diversity and relevance.

A higher value favors diversity (dissimilarity to selected results), while a lower value favors relevance (similarity to the query vector).

Must be in the range [0, 1]. Default value is 0.5.

candidates_limit.description:
The maximum number of candidates to consider for re-ranking.

If not specified, the `limit` value is used.

positive.description: Look for vectors closest to the vectors from these points

negative.description: Try to avoid vectors like the vector from these points

strategy.description: How to use the provided vectors to find the results

context.description: Search space will be constrained by these pairs of vectors

Fusion.description:
Fusion algorithm allows to combine results of multiple prefetches.

Available fusion algorithms:

* `rrf` - Reciprocal Rank Fusion (with default parameters) * `dbsf` - Distribution-Based Score Fusion

k.description: K parameter for reciprocal rank fusion

to.description: Payload field with the destination geo point

target.description: The target value to start decaying from. Defaults to 0.

scale.description: The scale factor of the decay, in terms of `x`. Defaults to 1.0. Must be a non-zero positive number.

midpoint.description: The midpoint of the decay. Should be between 0 and 1.Defaults to 0.5. Output will be this value when `|x - target| == scale`.

prefetch.description: Sub-requests to perform first. If present, the query will be performed on the results of the prefetch(es).

query.description: Query to perform. If missing without prefetches, returns points ordered by their IDs.

using.description: Define which vector name to use for querying. If missing, the default vector is used.

filter.description: Filter conditions - return only those points that satisfy the specified conditions.

params.description: Search params for when there is no prefetch

score_threshold.description: Return points with scores better than this threshold.

with_vector.description: Options for specifying which vectors to include into the response. Default is false.

with_payload.description: Options for specifying which payload to include or not. Default is false.

lookup_from.description: The location to use for IDs lookup, if not specified - use the current collection and the 'using' vector Note: the other collection vectors should have the same vector size as the 'using' vector in the current collection

group_by.description: Payload field to group by, must be a string or number field. If the field contains more than 1 value, all values will be used for grouping. One point can be in multiple groups.

group_size.description: Maximum amount of points to return per group. Default is 3.

limit.description: Maximum amount of groups to return. Default is 10.

with_lookup.description: Look for points in another collection using the group ids

shard_key.description: Specify in which shards to look for the points, if not specified - look in all shards

filter.description: Look only for points which satisfies this conditions

sample.description: How many points to select and search within. Default is 10.

limit.description: How many neighbours per sample to find. Default is 3.

using.description: Define which vector name to use for querying. If missing, the default vector is used.

ids.description: Ids of the points in order

pairs.description: List of pairs of points with scores

SearchMatrixPair.description: Pair of points (a, b) with score

key.description: Payload key to use for faceting.

limit.description: Max number of hits to return. Default is 10.

filter.description: Filter conditions - only consider points that satisfy these conditions.

exact.description: Whether to do a more expensive exact count for each of the values in the facet. Default is false.

Usage.description: Usage of the hardware resources, spent to process the request
